basics.name: Muhammad Nabeel Amin
basics.summary: Software engineer and AI researcher delivering production-ready ML, computer vision, and analytics solutions with measurable business impact.

work.name: Infiniti Software
work.summary: Delivering production-grade AI solutions across computer vision and analytics use cases.
highlights: Achieved 92% model accuracy and automated up to 80% of repetitive workflows by deploying TensorFlow, PyTorch, YOLOv5, and OpenCV pipelines.
Built scalable data pipelines with Tableau and Power BI dashboards, improving data accessibility and cutting processing time by 60%.

work.name: AirClass
work.summary: Mentored students in Python programming, AI fundamentals, and software craftsmanship.
highlights: Guided 100+ students through project-based learning paths in Python, PyGame, and Turtle.
Coached learners to build real-world applications emphasizing problem decomposition and debugging discipline.

work.name: Riphah International Colleges & University
work.summary: Led applied AI research on deep learning for precision agriculture.
highlights: Designed CNN architectures tailored to crop classification and yield prediction, reaching 99.7% training accuracy.
Translated research insights into actionable implementation guidance for agricultural stakeholders.

work.name: Optemastech
work.summary: Developed medical imaging and computer vision solutions for health-tech initiatives.
highlights: Built a 3D medical image segmentation pipeline using TensorFlow U-Net, reducing diagnostic processing time while improving accuracy.
Optimized OpenCV, Keras, and CUDA workloads to cut compute resource usage by 12% across multiple projects.

work.name: Bright Network
work.summary: Focused on real-time facial recognition and identity verification systems.
highlights: Developed Python/OpenCV pipelines for facial recognition and detection.
Improved model accuracy by 90% through facial landmark extraction and histogram-based filtering.
